ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Image of Cover (to show on abstract page)

The title of the item. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. There is no way to make italic text, please enter it normally. If you have a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Example: A brief history of time
Example: Life: an unauthorised biography
Example: Mathematics for engineers and scientists. 5th edition
Example: Ecosystems of the world. Vol. 26. Estuaries of the world

The title of the book, usually found on the title page. The title should not end with a full stop, but may end with a question mark. There is no way to make italic text, please enter it normally. If it has a subtitle, it should be preceded with a colon [:]. Use capitals only for the first word and for proper nouns.
Example: A brief history of time
Example: Life: an unauthorised biography
Example: Mathematics for engineers and scientists. 5th edition
Example: Ecosystems of the world. Vol. 26. Estuaries of the world
A summary of the items content. If the item has a formal abstract then that is what should be entered here. No complicated text formatting is possible.
Natural language terms to describe the content of the item

Enter in the format given on the first page or title page. If there are more than four authors, click on the [More Spaces] button.
Example: [Smith] [J.P.] [j.smith@soton.ac.uk]
Example: [Chance-Collins] [Chris] [chris@bar.com]
Example: [Fu] [Yan-Li] []
Example: [von Höpfner] [Ludwig G.] []

The total number of pages of the item.
Example: 123

Numerals only. The sequence of pages of the item. Do not enter pp.
Example: 21 to 34

The name of the series to which the document belongs. Enter without punctuation.
Example: Elseview Oceanography Series

The title of a journal, publication or magzine.
Example: Marine Biology

A person, firm or corporate body responsible for placing an item on the market. Do not use abbreviations, enter in full.
Example: Oxford University Press

Locality of the publisher. Use city or town then country. If city is not known then just use country.
Example: Southampton, UK
Example: Brazil

City or town then country where event was held. If city is not known then just use country.
Example: Rome, Italy
Example: Greece

Start and end dates for the event
Example: 13-15 Dec 2003
Example: 31 Oct - 02 Nov 1999

The title of the conference or workshop.
Example: 11th onference of PanHellenic Librarians
Example: SIGIR 2001

Unique 10 digit code identifying a book.
Example: 1 871438 57 8
Example: 067157826X

Unique 8 digit code identifying a serial.
Example: 1055-0143
Example: 0891-060X
The type of the item presented at a conference or workshop.
Title usually found on the title page (first page of book).

The canonical URL for this item. Some journals require you to provide a link to their version.
Example: http://www.stuffjournal.com/2003/3/

Please enter the names of the editors.
This field is required if no creators are listed.

The date this item was submitted to a publisher. Not the date of submission to this service.
Date of submission is required if the item has no date of issue. If the item has not yet been submitted to a journal, conference or publisher, or is not intended for submission then please enter the date it was completed as the date of issue.
The date this item was issued or published. For items not intended for publication this is the date they were completed or made public.
This is an automatic field, you should never see this text!
Enter the volume number of the journal or series in which your item appeared.
Enter the issue number of the journal or series in which your item appeared.
The unique identification number of this item, or a DOI.
The patent application number of this item.
The number, if any, of a technical report or similar item.
Please select the specific type of this monograph.
Please state here whether your deposit has been published, is currently in the process of being published (in press), or has not been previously published.
Please indicate whether this version of the work been refereed below.

Yes, this version has been refereed.
No, this version has not been refereed.
You are strongly encouraged to paste in the reference list of your item into the box below. It may be used to link your item to those it cites and to those that cite it.
Please select at least one main subject category, and optionally up to two other subject categories you think are appropriate for your submisson, from the list below.

If you think you can specify some useful information about your deposit that can't be entered anywhere else, please enter it here. This information will appear on the public summary page for this item.
Any comments to the editor. This information will not be displayed to the public.

Please enter the department from which the item originated.
Example: School of Electronics and Computer Science

Please enter the institution from which the item originated.
Example: University of Whitezombia

The name of the applicant to whom the patent was granted. May be a person or an organisation.
Example: Purdue Research Institute
Example: John K. Ducklingson

The date that a publisher- or funder-imposed embargo expires. On and after this date, all documents associated with this deposit will be made publically accessible. For more complex embargo requirements, please contact the repository administrator.
Example: 2006 - all documents made publically accessible on 1st January 2006
Example: 2006 June - all documents made publically accessible on 1st June 2006
The contact email address for this item.
A book or a conference volume.
A chapter or section in a book.
An article in a journal, magazine, newspaper. Not necessarily peer-reviewed. May be an electronic-only medium, such as an online journal or news website.

A paper, poster, speech, lecture or presentation given at a conference, workshop or other event. If the conference item has been published in a journal or book then please use "Book Section" or "Article" instead.
A monograph. This may be a technical report, project report, documentation, manual, working paper or discussion paper.
A published patent. Do not include as yet unpublished patent applications.
Something within the scope of the repository, but not covered by the other categories.
This option allows or prevents a users email being shown on their public summary page.

Make email visible to all.
Hide email to all except repository administrators.

Please list keyword/phrases describing your areas of specialisation using the terms likely to be used by someone searching for work in those areas. Avoid over-general terms (`chemistry') and over-particular terms (`my non-quantal theory of chemical reactions') that no one is likely to search on. Enter as many keyword/phrases as you wish.

Unfortunately your eprint:
could not be accepted into &archivename; as-is.
The eprint has been returned to your workspace. If you visit your item depositing page you will be able to edit your eprint, fix the problem and redeposit.

Unfortunately your eprint:
could not be accepted into &archivename;.
The eprint has been deleted.

ep:phrase.p: For work being deposited by its own author: In self-archiving this collection of files and associated bibliographic metadata, I grant &archivename; the right to store them and to make them permanently available publicly for free on-line. I declare that this material is my own intellectual property and I understand that &archivename; does not assume any responsibility if there is any breach of copyright in distributing these files or metadata. (All authors are urged to prominently assert their copyright on the title page of their work.)

For work being deposited by someone other than its author: I hereby declare that the collection of files and associated bibliographic metadata that I am archiving at &archivename;) is in the public domain. If this is not the case, I accept full responsibility for any breach of copyright that distributing these files or metadata may entail.
Clicking on the deposit button indicates your agreement to these terms.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Full text not available from this repository.

p.em: This is the latest version of this eprint.

ep:phrase.p: There is a more recent version of this eprint available. Click here to view it.

ep:phrase.h3: This is how the metadata summary page will look:
This is complete contents of all the fields in this eprint:
The depositing user made the following comments and suggestions:

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Repository Staff Only: edit this item
The URL given for is invalid. Did you include the initial http://?
The email given for is invalid.
Name in field is missing the "family" part.
Name in field is missing the "given names/initials" part.
Documents of type need a description.
An item must have at least one of a submission date and an issue date.
If an item does not have any creators then it must have at least one editor.

ep:phrase.p: Dear User,
Thank you for your interest in &archivename;.
You now need to activate your new password, click here.
Your username is: .
After you have successfully confirmed your password, you can deposit items here.

Once you have confirmed your identity you may also subscribe to the email alerts service, to be automatically informed of new deposits in the repository in your chosen subject areas in a daily, weekly or monthly digest.
You can create a subscription by clicking here.
Have your username and password ready when visiting any of the above pages.
This message was generated automatically by software. If you have any questions, then please feel free to email a real person at:
&adminemail;
Dear User,
You have requested your email to be changed to
To activate this new address please click here.
You need to register in order to be able to deposit eprints in the repository.

As a registered user you will be able to manage your eprints, up to the point of submitting them for Editorial Review. If the review is successful your eprint will be deposited in the repository, if it is unsuccessful it will be returned to you with editorial comments.
In addition to managing your eprints a registered user can set up subscription options, so that email notifications are sent when new eprints are placed in the repository.
Please complete the details on this page to register with &archivename;.

The registration process uses email to send you details of how to activate your account. You must then check your email and activate your password. Once activated you can start to use the registered features of the repository.
If you have already registered but have forgotten your username or password, click here to set a new password.
As a registered user you will be able to set up subscription options, so that email notifications are sent when new eprints are placed in the repository.
Please complete the details on this page to register with &archivename;.

The registration process uses email to send you details of how to activate your account. You must then check your email and activate your password. Once activated you can start to use the registered features of the repository.
If you have already registered but have forgotten your username or password, click here to set a new password.
These documents will be made publically accessible from .

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: You may enter a rationale for requesting this document.

ep:phrase.p: This item has been requested from the &archivename; by . Please can you respond.
The following reason was given:
Please consider removing restrictions or uploading the full text to the archive so that it will be available immediately to future searchers.
To send the requested document, click here.
To reject the request, click here.
Your request has been sent.
Your request for the following item has been passed on for action:
If you do not receive a reply or need advice at a later time please contact &adminemail;. For items with copyright implications, you may also be able to contact your local interlibrary loan service.
You have chosen to accept the request for the following item:
An acceptance notice will be emailed to the requester with the requested document attached.
You have chosen to reject the request for the following item:
You may enter a reason below if you wish. This will be emailed to the requester along with a rejection notice.
This item has been made publically accessible since the request was made:
A notice will be emailed to the requester.

ep:phrases.ep:phrase: Tick this box to make this document publically available from now on.

ep:phrase.p: Your request for the following item has been accepted:
Please find the requested document attached.
Your request for the following item has been rejected:
It may not always be straightforward to provide full text. Your local library may also be able to help you. For more general queries you may also contact &adminemail;
The following reason was given:
The item you requested is now publically accessible:
Thank you. The email has been sent to the requester.
